articles.title: Walton County woman loses $129,500 in Bitcoin scam
articles.author: Riley Lehman
articles.summary: A 77-year-old woman was instructed to withdraw $129,500 from her bank account and deposit it into a Bitcoin ATM machine. She made the transaction, but it was too late. The Walton County Sheriff's Office Crime Prevention division sees scams like this often, but not one of this size. The suspect is likely from overseas.

articles.title: New iPhone, Android Warning—Do Not Use Any Of These Apps
articles.author: Zak Doffman
articles.summary: Some apps in Google's Play Store and Apple's App Store have been infected with'malicious' code that lets attackers empty crypto wallets. The malicious code works by using OCR to scan a device's image gallery for potential words and phrases in multiple languages that might be secret codes to access or recover wallets. According to the time stamps in the malware files, SparkCat has been active since March 2024.

articles.title: Food and lifestyle: The intersection of culinary culture and cryptocurrency
articles.summary: The convergence of food culture and cryptocurrency has created fascinating new dynamics in how we experience, pay for, and interact with dining. Restaurants worldwide are increasingly accepting cryptocurrency payments. Some restaurants have launched their tokens, creating exclusive dining clubs where membership is verified through blockchain technology. Some ghost kitchen operations have implemented token-based voting systems.

articles.summary: Bitdeer Technologies Group (NASDAQ: BTDR) acquired a 101-megawatt gas-fired power project near Fox Creek, Alberta in an all-cash transaction for $21.7 million. It is expected to be energized by Q4 2026. Bitdeer plans to build a datacenter capacity for Bitcoin mining there.

articles.title: Bitcoin and the Creative Economy: Opportunities for Artists, Musicians, and Filmmakers
articles.summary: For the creative industry, Bitcoin offers transformative opportunities. Artists, musicians, and filmmakers can sell their work directly to fans using Bitcoin payments. Crowdfunding has become a lifeline for many creative projects, but traditional platforms often come with high fees and geographical restrictions. Bitcoin's decentralized nature provides a stable and accessible alternative to traditional platforms.

He claims it was stolen from him and sold without his knowledge by his art adviser as part of an elaborate fraud. articles.title: Elon Musk And His ‘Unknown Soldiers' Have The Federal Workforce ‘On Edge'
articles.author: Hunter Walker
articles.summary: Elon Musk was appointed to lead the 'Department of Government Efficiency' (DOGE) in the new Trump administration. Since Trump took office, DOGE has caused chaos in the federal agencies with its questionably legal push for access to sensitive data. In the past week, Musk associates gained access to Treasury Department pay systems and data sets at other agencies. They have also called for massive staff purges with an initial focus on the U.S. Agency for International Development (AID). The changes have led to resignations and widespread alarm from Democratic Party lawmakers and legal and security experts.

The victims are either threatened with legal action or warned of a financial breach, then they are instructed to transfer money to Bitcoin.

articles.title: S.E.C. Moves to Scale Back Its Crypto Enforcement Efforts
articles.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission is downsizing a special unit dedicated to bringing crypto enforcement actions. It is one of the first concrete steps by President Trump and his administration to pull back on the regulation of cryptocurrencies and other digital assets. Some of the lawyers in the crypto unit are being assigned to other departments in the S.E.C. The acting chair of the commission, Mark T. Uyeda, is a Republican who is supportive of the crypto industry.

articles.title: From Exchange to HODL: The Predictive Power of Bitcoin Exchange Outflows
articles.author: Mark
articles.summary: Exchange outflows measure the volume of bitcoin that investors withdraw from trading platforms to cold-storage. Historically, such withdrawals have been associated with a shift from short-term trading to long-term holding. They also directly reduce the liquid supply available for trading. High exchange outflows led to larger subsequent 30 day BTC returns.

The Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) gained access to the U.S. Treasury payment system, responsible for 1 billion payments per year totaling $5 trillion. It's unclear what Musk wants to do with the payment system. He has said that he could trim $1 trillion from the federal deficit by addressing waste, fraud and abuse.

articles.title: The U.S. Just Flipped The Crypto Game: Digital Asset Bicameral Group & Sovereign Wealth Fund—Is This The Start Of A Bitcoin-Powered Superpower?
articles.author: Becca Bratcher
articles.summary: Today, members of the bicameral group on cryptocurrency regulation, including the House Financial Services, House Agriculture, Senate Banking, and Senate Agriculture Committees, convened to advance a comprehensive regulatory framework for digital assets. The effort, developed in collaboration with the SEC's new Crypto Task Force, marks a shift from aggressive enforcement to clear, enforceable guidelines. The framework prioritizes stablecoin legislation to reinforce the U.S. dollar's dominance in global finance while driving demand for treasuries. The timing of this regulatory overhaul is no coincidence. Just 24 hours earlier, former President Trump signed an executive order establishing the US Sovereign Wealth Fund.

articles.summary: Secretary of State Michael Watson urges Mississippians to be aware of the increasing risks of investment scams and the consequences they have on their victims. Affinity fraud, or pig butchering, occurs when scammers build relationships with potential targets to gain trust. Gift card scams involve impersonating government agencies, financial institutions, or businesses to request an urgent payment with a gift card. Cryptocurrency scammers impersonate new or established businesses offering fraudulent coins or tokens while promising high returns.
